Risk.Severity: picklist: Negligible, Minor, Serious, Critical, Catastrophic
Risk.Probability Before: picklist: Improbable, Remote, Occasional, Probable, Frequent
Risk.Probability After: picklist: Improbable, Remote, Occasional, Probable, Frequent

Mitigation.Control Type: picklist: Inherent Safety, Protective Measure, Information for Safety

work_items.title: RISK-001: Incorrect Heart Rate Reading
work_items.description: The device may display incorrect heart rate readings due to sensor malfunction or poor skin contact, leading to delayed treatment.

work_items.title: RISK-002: Missed Arrhythmia Alert
work_items.description: Critical arrhythmia event not detected or alert not delivered to patient/caregiver, resulting in failure to seek emergency care.

fields.Harm: Death or serious injury from untreated arrhythmia

work_items.title: RISK-003: Patient Data Breach
work_items.description: Unauthorized access to protected health information (PHI) stored on device or transmitted to cloud services.

fields.Harm: Privacy violation, identity theft, patient distress

work_items.title: RISK-004: Battery Depletion During Monitoring
work_items.description: Device battery depletes without warning during critical monitoring period, leaving patient unmonitored.

fields.Harm: Undetected cardiac event during gap in monitoring

work_items.title: RISK-005: Skin Irritation from Prolonged Wear
work_items.description: Extended skin contact with device materials causes irritation, allergic reaction, or pressure injury.

fields.Harm: Skin damage, allergic reaction, user discontinues monitoring

work_items.title: MIT-001: Redundant Sensor Algorithm
work_items.description: Implement dual-sensor validation algorithm that cross-checks readings from primary and secondary heart rate sensors. Alert user when readings diverge beyond acceptable threshold.

work_items.title: MIT-002: Multi-Channel Alert System
work_items.description: Implement redundant alert delivery through: 1) On-device vibration and audio, 2) Mobile app push notification, 3) SMS to emergency contacts, 4) Cloud-based monitoring dashboard for caregivers.

fields.Verification Method: End-to-end alert delivery testing, failure mode simulation

work_items.title: MIT-003: End-to-End Encryption
work_items.description: Implement AES-256 encryption for data at rest and TLS 1.3 for data in transit. Apply HIPAA-compliant access controls with role-based authentication.

work_items.title: MIT-004: Predictive Battery Management
work_items.description: Implement battery monitoring system with: 1) 24-hour advance low battery warning, 2) 4-hour critical warning with escalation to caregiver, 3) Graceful shutdown with data preservation.

fields.Verification Method: Battery drain testing across temperature ranges

work_items.title: MIT-005: Hypoallergenic Materials with Wear Guidance
work_items.description: Use ISO 10993 certified hypoallergenic materials for all skin-contact surfaces. Provide user instructions for recommended wear duration and skin care.

fields.Verification Method: Biocompatibility testing per ISO 10993, user study

work_items.title: US-101: View Risk Dashboard
work_items.description: As a quality engineer, I want to view a dashboard showing all identified risks and their current status so that I can monitor overall product risk profile.
work_items.acceptance_criteria:
- Display risk matrix (severity x probability)
- Show count of risks by status
- Filter by risk level (Acceptable/ALARP/Unacceptable)
- Export to PDF for regulatory submission

work_items.title: US-102: Link Requirements to Risks
work_items.description: As a systems engineer, I want to link product requirements to associated risks so that I can ensure traceability for regulatory compliance.
work_items.acceptance_criteria:
- Create bidirectional links between requirements and risks
- Generate traceability matrix report
- Alert when requirement changes affect linked risks

work_items.title: TC-001: Verify Arrhythmia Detection Accuracy
work_items.description: Verify that the device correctly detects atrial fibrillation with sensitivity >= 95% and specificity >= 90% using MIT-BIH Arrhythmia Database.
work_items.steps:
1. Load MIT-BIH test dataset
2. Run detection algorithm
3. Compare results to annotated ground truth
4. Calculate sensitivity and specificity

work_items.title: TC-002: Verify Alert Delivery Latency
work_items.description: Verify that critical alerts are delivered to all configured channels within 30 seconds of detection.
work_items.steps:
1. Configure multi-channel alerts
2. Simulate critical arrhythmia event
3. Measure time from detection to delivery on each channel
4. Repeat 100 times
work_items.expected_result: 95th percentile latency < 30 seconds for all channels
